acknowledgments.summary: Gjoko “LiquidWorm” Krstic from Zero Science Lab (MK) reported this vulnerability to Siemens.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to cause a denial-of-service condition on the device’s web server, requiring a reboot to recover the web interface.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE SECTORS: Chemical, Critical Manufacturing, Energy, Food and Agriculture, Water and Wastewater Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-19-318-03 - Web Scraped Version

branches.name: PXC22.1-E.D PXC36-E.D PXC36.1-E.D with activated web server

cwe.name: External Control of Assumed-Immutable Web Parameter

notes.text: An attacker with network access to an affected device could send a specially crafted HTTP message to the web server port (TCP/80), which would cause the server to reply with status code 404 to any further requests. Exploitation requires no system privileges and no user interaction. A reboot is required to recover the web interface. This vulnerability may impact the availability of the affected system. CVE-2019-13927 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 5.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Siemens has an update available for the following affected products:
Siemens has identified the following specific workarounds and mitigations that users can apply to reduce risk:

As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends customers protect network access to affected products with appropriate mechanisms. Siemens advises all users to follow recommended security practices to run the devices in a protected environment.
For more information on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT:http://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
For more information on the vulnerability and more detailed mitigation instructions, please see Siemens Security Advisory SSA-898181 at the following location: http://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories
